relation: Specifies whether the SNMP agent is enabled. If enabled, the SNMP subagent gathers information about the server and passes the information to the master agent. Default value: true.
(Optional) Specifies the description of the server. The value must be in text format.
(Optional) Specifies the name of the organization responsible for the server. The value must be in text format.
(Optional) Specifies the location of the server. The value must be in text format.
(Optional) Specifies the contact information of the person responsible for the server. The value must be in text format.

textBeforeTable: Table 3-22 snmp Subelements Table 3-22 describes the subelements of snmp. The snmp element configures the server's SNMP subagent. This element can appear zero or one time within the server element. For more information, see Section 3.1.22, "server". 3.1.23 snmp Specifies the path to a file containing the Web Application Firewall (WAF) module rules. For more information, see Section 3.1.37, "webapp-firewall-ruleset" 0 or more webapp-firewall-ruleset Configures a TCP service. For more information, see Section 3.1.30, "tcp-proxy" 0 or more tcp-proxy Configures a TCP listener. For more information, see Section 3.1.29, "tcp-listener" 0 or more tcp-listener Configures TCP access log for the server. For more information, see Section 3.1.28, "tcp-access-log" 0 or 1 tcp-access-log Configures the TCP request processing threads. For more information, see Section 3.1.31, "tcp-thread-pool"
textAfterTable: See Also: stats 3.1.24 ssl The ssl element configures the SSL/TLS settings. This element can appear zero or one time within the http-listener element. For more information, see Section 3.1.10, "http-listener". Table 3-23 describes the subelements of ssl. Table 3-23 ssl Subelements Element Occurrences Description enabled 0 or 1 Specifies whether SSL support is enabled for the listener. Default value: true. server-cert-nickname 0 or more Specifies the nickname of the certificate that the server presents to the clients. You can specify zero or one RSA certificate, and zero or one ECC certificate. ssl3 0 or 1 Specifies whether SSL3 connections are accepted. Default value: true.
